Traxler Counter Attack

Mar 24, 2025

The Traxler counter attack derives from the two knights defense from black after white develops into the Italian game. After white moves his knight to g5, attacking the weakened f7 square, black counter attacks with Bc5, disregarding his own safety for a lethal attack on whiteâ€™s king side.

  1. e4 e5
  2. Nf3 Nc6
  3. Bc4 Nf6
  4. Ng5 Bc5

Duckduckgo results about Traxler Counter Attack

Learn how to play the Traxler Counterattack, a sharp and aggressive variation of the Italian Game. See the moves, analysis, and top players of this opening on Chess.com.
